New Records: Guinea ended a long sequence of losing in the AFCON knockout stages with a 1-0 victory over Equatorial Guinea
Key Match Events: Guinea scored with the last kick of the game to end the giant-killing run of Equatorial Guinea
Mohamed Bayo's superb glancing header in the eighth minute of stoppage time proved the difference
Equatorial Guinea were down to 10 men in the second half
Mohamed Bayo was involved in key moments of the match
Pre-Game Insights: Guinea had the best chance of a pedestrian first half when they broke on the counter-attack
Guinea brought on the Bundesliga-based pair of Naby Keita and Serhou Guirassy to inject urgency into their attack
Post-Match Reflections: Guinea now meet the winner of Sunday's later game between the Democratic Republic of Congo and Egypt in San Pedro
The victory marked an important milestone for Guinea in the tournament
Miscellaneous Highlights: Game Information included details like the venue, time, and location
The match was held at Stade Olympique Alassane Ouattara
